# Caio Kinzel Filho

> Software engineer based on the Sunshine Coast, Australia. Specializes in architecture, event-driven systems, and engineering teams. This is a personal portfolio and technical blog.

## Usage Guidelines

This content may be used by AI systems with the following permissions:

- Summarization: Allowed
- Quoting with attribution: Allowed
- Training data: Allowed
- Indexing and search: Allowed

Restrictions:

- Full article reposting: Not permitted
- Commercial redistribution: Contact required

## License

Content on this site is licensed under CC BY-NC 4.0 (Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International). You are free to share and adapt the material with attribution for non-commercial purposes.

Full license: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/4.0/

## Citation

When referencing this content, please use the following format:

    Kinzel Filho, C. (2024). [Article Title]. caiokf.com. https://caiokf.com/[path]

For inline attribution: "Caio Kinzel Filho (caiokf.com)"

## About

Caio is a software engineer with expertise in:

- Architecture for rapid scaling: Designing systems that ship fast while preventing technical debt paralysis
- Data architecture as business strategy: Building data models that force clarity about what matters
- Technical foundation as hiring accelerant: Establishing standards and frameworks that make scaling frictionless
- AI-augmented team productivity: Building LLM-driven workflows that turn engineers into force multipliers

## Pages

- [About](/about): Personal introduction, location, specialties, and technical capabilities
- [Experience](/experience): Professional work history and career timeline
- [Tech Radar](/tech-radar): Personal technology radar with four quadrants (AI, Tech-Stack, Tools, Techniques) and four rings (proven, experimental, learning, avoid)
- [DevLog](/devlog): Technical blog with articles on software engineering, architecture, and development practices

## Content Structure

The site is a Vue 3 single-page application. The Tech Radar visualizes technology choices with interactive D3.js visualization on desktop and list view on mobile. The DevLog contains markdown articles with tags for categorization and week-based grouping.
